title: HRanges
content:
The HRanges indicator is designed to determine and display price ranges based on certain conditions. Local extrema consisting of 5 candles are considered. At the time of formation, the range is considered flat. After the breakout, depending on which direction the breakout was in, this range is considered bullish or bearish. It is possible to set filters by maximum volume and number of bars in the range.

To add and set up the indicator, open the Indicators settings window.


Indicator's settings

Calculation

NameDescription
Days look back Refers to the number of previous days taken into account when calculating an indicator.

Volume filter

NameDescription
Filter Maximum volumes greater than the value set in this filter will be ignored.
Hide All Determines whether to hide ranges that do not pass the maximum volume filter.

Bars count filter

NameDescription
Filter This property is used to specify the number of candles that should be aggregated before the main calculation takes place.
Hide All Determines whether to hide ranges that do not pass the bars count filter.

Visualization

NameDescription
Break Up Color Sets the color for elements with a bullish direction.
Maximum Volume Color Sets the color for elements with maximum volume.
Break Dn Color Sets the color for elements with a bearish direction.
Flat Color Sets the color for elements with a neutral direction.
Width Defines the thickness of lines or elements in the chart
